    • cardChoice

      public int cardChoice​(java.io.BufferedReader entry) throws java.io.IOException
      make the player choose a card in the terminal while the number chosen is valid
      Parameters:
      entry - allow the player to enter their choice in the terminal
      Returns:
      the entered number (corresponding to the choice)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the entered value causes an error

    • playCard

      public boolean playCard​(int index_card, int index_hand)
      play a card and remove it from the player's hand.

      if the played card can enter the fireworks board, then the card is added to that board. One clue is restored if a color is completed

      otherwise, the card is send to the discarded pile and the group loses a life

      Parameters:
      index_card - the index of the card to play
      index_hand - the index of the player who is playing the card
      Returns:
      false if index_card is equal to 0 and true otherwise

    • throwCard

      public boolean throwCard​(int index_card, int index_hand)
      throw a card in the discarded pile and, if the current number of clue is inferior to 8, add a clue
      Parameters:
      index_card - the index of the card to throw
      index_hand - the index of the player who is throwing the card
      Returns:
      false if index_card is equal to -1 and true otherwise

    • playerChoice

      public int playerChoice​(int player, java.io.BufferedReader entry) throws java.io.IOException
      make the player choose a player to give a clue to in the terminal while the number chosen is valid
      Parameters:
      player - the number of the player giving the clue
      entry - allow the player to enter their choice in the terminal
      Returns:
      the entered number, corresponding to the number of the chosen player
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the entered value causes an error

    • typeOfClue

      public static int typeOfClue​(java.io.BufferedReader entry) throws java.io.IOException
      make the player choose the type of clue they want to give in the terminal while the number chosen is valid
      Parameters:
      entry - allow the player to enter their choice in the terminal
      Returns:
      the entered number, corresponding to the type of clue (number or color)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the entered value causes an error

    • clueChoice

      public static int clueChoice​(int choice, java.io.BufferedReader entry) throws java.io.IOException
      make the player choose the number/color (depending on the choice made)

      they want to give in the terminal while the number chosen is valid

      Parameters:
      choice - correspond to 1 if the player chose to give a number or 2 if they chose to give a color
      entry - allow the player to enter their choice in the terminal
      Returns:
      choice if choice is equal to 0 or the number/color the player entered otherwise
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the entered value causes an error

    • readInt

      public static int readInt​(java.io.BufferedReader entry) throws java.io.IOException
      read the first entered character
      Parameters:
      entry - allow the player to enter their choice in the terminal
      Returns:
      the entered character
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the entered value causes an error

    • readJump

      public static void readJump​(java.io.BufferedReader entry) throws java.io.IOException
      allow to skip the rest of a line of the terminal
      Parameters:
      entry - allow the player to enter their choice in the terminal
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the entered value causes an error

    • giveClueTerminal

      public boolean giveClueTerminal​(int index_hand, java.io.BufferedReader entry, int nb_player) throws java.io.IOException
      the primary function to give a clue. It calls all the other function to give a clue
      Parameters:
      index_hand - the index of the hand giving a clue
      entry - allow the player to enter their choice in the terminal
      nb_player - the number of player
      Returns:
      false if the called functions return 0 or -1 and true otherwise
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the entered value causes an error

    • giveClueGraph

      public boolean giveClueGraph​(fr.umlv.zen5.ApplicationContext context, int index_hand, int choice, SimpleGameView.Area area, float width, float height, int num_discard, int nb_player)
      the primary function to give a clue in graphic. It calls all the other function to give a clue
      Parameters:
      context - contains the informations of the current graphic window
      index_hand - the index of the hand giving a clue
      choice - the player's choice of action
      area - the instance that allow to draw
      width - the width of the window
      height - the height of the window
      num_discard - the number of the card to draw in the discarded pile
      nb_player - the number of player
      Returns:
      false if one of the choices is 0

    • giveClueAnnex

      public void giveClueAnnex​(int choice, int choice_player, int deep_choice, int index_hand, int nb_player)
      give a clue to the chosen player
      Parameters:
      choice - the player's choice of action
      choice_player - the number of the player that is given a clue
      deep_choice - 1 for a clue on the color and 2 for a clue on the number
      index_hand - the index of the hand giving a clue
      nb_player - the number of player
